name: DEFIBaseTokenOrchestrator
description: DEFIBaseTokenOrchestrator. The orchestrator is the main entry point for rebase operations. It coordinates the policy actions with external consumers.

functionDecorators.name: addTransaction
functionDecorators.description: Adds a transaction that gets called for a downstream receiver of rebases.

functionDecorators.name: owner
functionDecorators.description: Returns the address of the current owner.

functionDecorators.name: rebase
functionDecorators.description: Main entry point to initiate a rebase operation. The DEFIBaseTokenOrchestrator calls rebase on the policy and notifies downstream applications. Contracts are guarded from calling, to avoid flash loan attacks on liquidity providers. If a transaction in the transaction list reverts, it is swallowed and the remaining transactions are executed.

parameterDecorators.name: index
parameterDecorators.description: Index of transaction to remove. Transaction ordering may have changed since adding.

functionDecorators.name: renounceOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

parameterDecorators.name: index
parameterDecorators.description: Index of transaction. Transaction ordering may have changed since adding.

parameterDecorators.name: enabled
parameterDecorators.description: True for enabled, false for disabled.

returnDecorators.description: Number of transactions, both enabled and disabled, in transactions list.

functionDecorators.name: transferOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
